resources.string:
Operation Schedule

The Metro provides commercial service from Monday through Saturday between 4:30 am and 11 pm, on Sundays and holidays open from 5:00 am to 10:00 pm.
 
Frequency of vehicles:

Trains have different travel times depending on the time and day of the week. The moments of higher occupancy vehicles called "rush hour" (5:00 am to 8:00 am and from 3:30 pm to 7:30 pm). Other times of the day in which the flow is less are called "off-peak hours" (8:00 am to 3:30 pm and after 7:30 pm). Metro units come to Metro stations during peak hours every 4 and a half minutes with trains of 6 cars. At peak times, trains arrive at stations every 6 or 7 minutes, depending on the time and day.
 
Metrocable:

The Metrocable provides commercial service Monday through Saturday between 4:30 am and 11 pm; on Sundays and public holidays, Metrocable start operation from 9:00 am to 10:00 pm.
 
L Line:

The Cable operates between 9:00 am and 6:00 pm every day, except the first business day of each week. That is, if Monday is a holiday, the cable does not work on Tuesday to perform maintenance.
 
Frequency of vehicles:

Metrocable cabins have a frequency of a few seconds between vehicles, because they have less capacity (10 users per cabin) its frequency is higher.

The following rates were set by the Metropolitan Board through the Metropolitan Agreement No. 18 of 5 December 2011. Shall take effect from Monday, January 2, 2012:
 
Trip with Tarjeta Cívica for Frequent Users: $1.550

 Trip with Tarjeta Cívica:$1.600
 
Student Trip METRO: $1.250

Student Trip Municipality: $800

Elderlies Trip: $1.470
 
Person with Reduced Mobility Trip: $1.190

Eventual Trip(for tourists or casual users. Apply for METRO, Metrocable and bus line 1): $1.800
 
These are the rates of Integrated Tickets:

Metrosan Micro and Buseta: $1.900

MEI - Calatrava: $2.000
 
Santa Rita Zamora – San Antonio Prado – Floresta y Calasanz – Móvil Plus – Robledo – Villa Hermosa – Más Medellín Castilla – San Cristóbal – Poblado – La América – Campo Valdés – Blanquizal – Centro Oriental – Simón Bolívar - MEI Guayabal - Micro-Nororiental: $2.100
 
Bus and Micro Bello – Bus and Micro Copacabana – MEI Itagüí – MEI Estrella –Circular Itagüí: $2.050
 
Micro Caldas: $2.150

Micro Sabaneta – Micro Envigado: $2.200

Bus Girardota: $2.350

Micro Girardota: $2.700
 
San Félix: $2.950

Bus Barbosa: $3.050

Envigado Las Palmas: $3.100

Taxi Girardota: $3.150

Micro Barbosa: $3.850
 
Cable Arví:
 
With Tarjeta Cívica, Personal and Sisbén 1, 2 ó 3: $100 (Entering from METRO transfer) and $350 one way (Entering directly from Cable Arví stations)
 
Without Cívica Personal and with Sisbén: $350 each way (Entering from METRO transfer) and $350 one way (Entering directly from Cable Arví stations)
 
Without Sisbén: $3.500 each way
 
All children up to one meter to measure: do not pay
